pr_title: Add option to choose the preferred media player in settings

timeline.message: Add option to choose the preferred media player in settings
Remove strings for external player option

timeline.bodyText: Does it make sense to maintain a config version? I have been thinking it may be less overhead to just check if a specific preference exists and set the default value if it does not.
timeline.author: thornbill

replies.bodyText:
I think it does make sense! Imagine a setting being renamed or (like in this case) a setting replacing another one. It would be annoying if the app auto-updates via the play store and suddenly your behavior changed because there is no migration. In this case external player users wouldn't use the external player anymore.
I do however think that the way this is done is ugly, in the future we might want to separate the preferences to a custom class which brings type safety (using enums instead of strings etc.) and handles migration a bit better.
This class could have getters & setters that need to be called and could use shared preferences as storage or maybe even sqlite.
replies.author: nielsvanvelzen

replies.bodyText: I've created a simple class for usage in my apps with these simple getters and setters and I've used it a lot. Might save a little bit of work https://github.com/Florianisme/SharedPreferences
